text: Unfortunately more rain coming over the next few days. It's not possible to say whether the current flooding in Henley-on-Thames is due to greenhouse gas emissions, but we do know that climate change causes wetter winters and so flooding is more likely.  Stay up to date with the @EnvAgencySE Flood Warning at https://t.co/Z8VGC7SQK3

You are 100% right, Dr Paul! I have met @EnvAgency frontline folk in a variety of capacities and they are dedicated underpaid people who work there to help make a difference. That their 'superiors' - a term I use in the loosest sense - behave like this for huge salaries is sick. https://t.co/N5LqxiMwjV

urls.title: EA boss backtracks on sewage pollution blunder
urls.description: Environment Agency chief executive Sir James Bevan has been forced to issue a clarification after he incorrectly told a House of Commons committee that the regulator did not allow water firms to discharge raw sewage into chalk streams.
